The formal approach to evaluating whether a time series is stationary begins with an inspection followed by analysis of the autocorrelation function ( 16
– 19). Our investigation showed that the autocorrelation function for the 244-y P time series from the Radcliffe Observatory in the United Kingdom is indistinguishable from that for a random process ( Fig. 1). We then extended this to a 70-y global P database and found that the autocorrelation function at most (
∼
76.3%) grid boxes is also indistinguishable from that for a stationary random process ( Fig. 2).
